verb.description: Engage in petty argument or bargaining.
examples: she advised him not to dicker over the extra fee

verb.description: Treat something casually or irresponsibly; toy with something.
examples: there was no dickering with the lyrics

origin: Early 19th century (originally US): perhaps from obsolete dicker set of ten (hides), used as a unit of trade, based on Latin decem ten.
